lines.text: Marriages don't work when one partner is happy and the other is miserable. Marriage is about both people being equally miserable.
You're out of here, Jabbar!
Are you nuts? It's my farewell game.
Well then, let me be the first to say farewell.
You asked for it, you got it, Toyota.
Grab your new best friends, Ben and Jerry, and let's turn your ass into a helipad.
[looking at Rodin's "The Thinker"]
Rodin never said what he was thinking.
You see, what I think he was thinking was, "Goddam Rodin. Three drinks and I'm nude."

[discussing the bridge from "An American in Paris", Mickey sings a line from the movie]
"It's very clear..."
Patton.
Do you sleep with the window open?
Yeah.
I don't like it. You will have to stop that.
Ok.
Do you squeeze the toothpaste at the top or the bottom?
Top.
Don't do that I hate that. If you ever use my car, make sure the mirror is back where I put it.
Ok, I can do that.
All right. Do you want to talk about religion, politics, whether you want to have kids or not.
Nah, that crap will work itself out, we are fine with the big issues.
Ok, I'll marry you.
I was thinking of doing some sightseeing.
Sightseeing? In Paris? What a bizarre notion.
Sure. You got any stuff here?
Yeah, we got some stuff. Would you like to see the Eiffel Tower?
That's here?
We were faxing each other's brains out.
We were great in Paris.
Forget Paris.
Forget Paris? How do you forget the best week in your life?
Maybe that's just all we were - just a great week.
HEY. If someone does not tell me about this baby, ASSES WILL BE KICKED.
I Like her!
You just had one of those 'I glued a bird to my head' days.
I am very impressed, you've got little kids over here, 2-3 years old, and they're already speaking French.
Here, have some bread. Everything will look better after bread.

[Mickey finds out Ellen is married]
You don't do this to a person, you know? You don't walk around being fabulous when you know you're not available.

[about Ellen's husband]
Is he French?
Yes.
Is he handsome?
Yes.
Is he rich?
Yes.
Does he have a sister?
It's like me, fruity yet oddly appealing.

[During a marriage counseling session]
When I come home, I'm excited to see you
You're not excited, you're horny
Is that bad? Is that such a bad thing?
Never say, "famous last words," because they could be.
You're a disturbed person, aren't you?

[Using the exact words - with similar deadpan voice and facial expression - of Jeremy Irons as the character Claus von Bulow replying to a similar comment in the 1990 film, "Reversal of Fortune"]
You have no idea.
